q: Despite his support for Barack Obama , Colin Powell would make no commitment yet for the 2012 White House race. "I will always vote for the person who I think is best qualified," he said. I am not committed to any candidate until I see all the candidates. I have not yet seen anybody on the Republican side that I am ready to commit to and I am not committed to Barack Obama either. 1. administration, possibly replacing Robert Gates as defense secretary, Colin Powell said he is not interested in a government role. , Donald Rumsfeld was at odds with Donald Rumsfeld of State Colin Powell about Iraq. The differences were not personal, Donald Rumsfeld says. He recalls receiving a book that Henry Kissinger had written, with the inscription, To an occasional adversary and a permanent friend.
